TopicTitle: That annoying alternate camera view of KSC upon game load with loss of control.

Articles.Content:
So, when loading a saved game (e.g. just after loading up KSP), I often get this view, which has plagued me since I started playing KSP way back in v0.18.

The problem with this is that you lose all control over the game - you have to Cmd+Q or Alt+F4 out of the game because nothing works. (I've had this happen on Linux, OS X, and Windows).

I have always played a heavily modded game, so I have no idea which mod is responsible.

I have also always had two monitors on my computer - one with KSP and one usually with a web browser open so I can waste time while waiting the ten minutes for KSP to load (I run a *lot* of mods... I really look forward to a stable 64-bit version of KSP, but I digress...).

So, as it turns out, after clicking the Load Game button in the main menu, while waiting for the saved game to load, I always buggered around on Facebook or something while waiting. However, I found a consistent work-around for the problem: don't Alt-Tab/Cmd+Tab or do anything in any other program. Force yourself to sit through the game loading time. Doing it this way, you never get that weird camera view, and you keep control over the game.

Hope this helps someone.

Oh, and before anyone asks: there is nothing out of the ordinary in the log file.

As far as I can tell, KAC causes this. I only ever experience this bug when I switch from one save to another where the Universal Time is after one or more alarms are set to trigger - in which case it happens every single time like... uh, clockwork.

The best solution is, when you know you want to switch to a save "in the future", close the game and then go straight to that save from the menu. You can go back to saves "in the past" with no trouble.
